      • Routes

        public Routes()

    • Method Detail

      • addRoute

        public java.lang.Boolean addRoute(Route roo)
        This method inserts a Route into the database and furthermore maintains a List of inserted Routes.
        Parameters:
        roo - Route to be inserted into the DB.
        Returns:
        true if the Route was successfully added, else false.

      • removeRoute

        public java.lang.Boolean removeRoute(Route roo)
        This method removes a given Route from the database of Routes and updates the list of maintained Routes accordingly.
        Parameters:
        roo - the Route to be removed from both the DB and list of Routes.
        Returns:
        true given the Route exists in the DB and is successfully removed. Else false.

      • getRoute

        public Route getRoute(java.lang.String routeName)
        This returns the route that the user has entered. It will return the calulated route for the user.
        Parameters:
        routeName - The name of the saved route in the database
        Returns:
        The specified route

      • search

        public Route search(java.lang.String target)

      • getRoutes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Route> getRoutes(Locations loc)
        This function returns a List of Routes with the same starting and ending Locations. Using the start and end Locations as a key when querying the DB may return multiple Routes because Routes can have the same start and end Locations but the wayPoints of each Route may be unique. This behaviour could or could not be desireable (ie: we could provide the user with multiple Routes to the same destination and the users preference(s) will serve as a decider as to which Route he/she wants to take)
        Parameters:
        loc - Locations object encapsulating the start and end Locations.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Route's with the specified start and end Locations.

      • getPreferedRoute

        public Locations getPreferedRoute(Locations loc)
        This function returns a Route based on a given user preference.
        Parameters:
        loc - Locations object encapsulating the start and end Locations.
        Returns:
        a Locations object encapsulating the possible Route's that can be taken to reach the destination.

      • savePreference

        public java.lang.Boolean savePreference(java.lang.String pref)
        This method saves the prefered routes that the user deems useful. It saves the selected route to the preferences database.

      • modifyRoute

        public Route modifyRoute(Route currRoute)
        This method calculates and returns the simplest routes for people with disabilities
        Parameters:
        currRoute - The route that has to be modified
        Returns:
        The modified route
